intro: Gyrocarpus jacquinii, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a tropical tree belonging to the family Hippocastanaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces distinctive fruits that are woody and covered in a fibrous, spongy layer. It thrives in brackish water environments, often found in mangrove ecosystems along coastlines. Gyrocarpus jacquinii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial species.
